analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The forward and reverse order of the three-factored table of contents

original: 16.26. Vedanāttika, Hetuduka🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca  na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya
translated: The section on feeling, the two-factored table

original: sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… satta pañhā.
analyzed: sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo  uppajjati hetu paccayā pe satta pañhā
translated: A wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, having a cause as condition, a thought associated with pleasant feeling, having no cause, arises. A wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, having a cause as condition, a thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, having no cause, arises. A wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, having a cause as condition, a thought associated with painful feeling, having no cause, arises. … seven questions.

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta pañhā.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā satta pañhā
translated: A wholesome thought associated with painful feeling, having a cause as condition, a thought associated with painful feeling, having no cause, arises. … seven questions.

original: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta pañhā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā satta pañhā saṅkhitta
translated: With the condition being a cause that is associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, there arises a result that is not a cause disassociated from neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of condition being a cause. … (Seven questions.)

original: Hetuyā ekavīsa …pe… vipāke cuddasa …pe… avigate ekavīsa. (Sabbattha ekavīsa.)🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: hetuyā ekavīsa pe vipāke cuddasa pe avigate ekavīsa sabbattha ekavīsa  sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  na na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhamma
translated: (In brief:) With the condition being a cause, there is the arising of twenty-one … With the condition being a result, there is the arising of fourteen … With the condition being an unobscured indeterminate, there is the arising of twenty-one. (Everywhere twenty-one.)🔽With the condition being a non-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling, there arises a result that is not a cause disassociated from painful feeling, by way of condition being a cause. With the condition being a non-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling,🔽there arises a result that is not a cause disassociated from neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of condition being a cause.

original: paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto
